ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Network setup help
ygData.msgSnippet: The ram is no issue but the card is a Geoforce 2. I will try this soon. Thanks ... action=topics&forum=Technical+Help&number=3&DaysPrune=20&LastLogin= ...
ygData.messageBody:
The ram is no issue but the card is a Geoforce 2.
I will try this soon.

Thanks


--- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@...> wrote:
> Which Nvidia card do you have? If you can, go to 512
> on the memory
> and at least the Nvidia gforce 3. Gforce 4 Ti if you
> can.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
>
> --- In EverQuest@y..., Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...>
> wrote:
> > hey can I ask if you have Luclin and use the new
> ui?
> > If so, can you tell me the Amount of Ram in the
> > system, the video ram, and the bus speed if you
> happen
> > to know it.
> >
> > the reason I ask is I bought a new machine Intel
> > Celeron 1.2Ghz processor with over 300 MB ram and
> > Nvidia 32MB ram card. The game runs ok but I can't
> use
> > the new UI else I get Mouse lag or hesitation like
> > MAD.
> >
> > And when spells are cast, the mouse is VERY slow.
> > the graphics are fine though and actually run
> smooth.
> > I have about 15 Luclin graphic images turned on.
> >
> > Let me know
> >
> > Thanks
> >
> > --- Kuervodr@n... wrote:
> > > This might be a little late, heh. I just got my
> P4
> > > 1.8ghz system in the other day and have been
> busy
> > > playing with that. EQ runs awesome on it too.
> > > Anyway, now I'm playing catch-up on the
> e-mails....
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > > Very good suggestions from the others. I haven't
> > > seen an answer if those worked for you or not.
> If it
> > > did, great! If not tho, you might want to head
> on
> > > over to the EQ tech forums, as this topic has
> been
> > > brought up lots of times over there, and do a
> search
> > > of that forum for "linksys" or something
> similar.
> > > You should come up with a number of threads you
> can
> > > read through for various possible solutions.
> Good
> > > luck!
> > >
> > >
> > http://boards.station.sony.com/ubb/everquest/cgi-
> bin/forumdisplay.cgi?
>
action=topics&forum=Technical+Help&number=3&DaysPrune=20&LastLogin=
> > >
> > >
> > > ----- Original Message -----
> > > From: "Ariaya" <ariaya@c...>
> > > To: <EverQuest@y...>
> > > Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2002 10:20 PM
> > > Subject: [EverQuest] Network setup help
> > >
> > >
> > > > Hi,
> > > >
> > > > I'm hoping that someone on this board can
> help. I
> > > just installed an
> > > > at home network with an ethernet DSL modem, 2
> > > computers and a LinkSys
> > > > router (with switch built in).
> > > >
> > > > For some reason, the router seems to be making
> me
> > > disconnect from EQ
> > > > VERY frequently! 9 or 10 times a night!!
> > > >
> > > > I unplugged the router and just plugged the
> > > computer into the modem
> > > > and everything worked.
> > > >
> > > > Any suggestions on how I can get this network
> > > going?
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
